#Text=Use
#Text=Yummly
#Text=Yummly is an easy way to view recipes that conform to your personal wishes , needs , and tastes .

#Text=The site draws on existing recipe sites on the internet ( AllRecipes , Food Network , Martha Stewart , Epicurious , etc. ) to combine the results in a way that you have indicated best suits your own needs .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Join
#Text=Yummly .
#Text=You can join following the prompts from the " Register " button on the front page - http://www.yummly.com/ .
#Text=Or you can simply sign in using your Facebook details .
#Text=Configure your preferences .
#Text=Once you 're joined up , you can set a large range of preferences under the " Favorite Recipes " tab as follows :

#Text=Choose whether or not you want your FoodFinder searches restricted to your preferences .
#Text=Select the tastes that you like and do n't like .
#Text=Under " Taste Preferences " tab , you can add in your " Likes and dislikes " .

column1: #Text=Simply start writing in your favorites and your dislikes , and the auto-prompt will make lots of suggestions for you to choose from .
#Text=This is useful for both finding suitable recipes and for connecting with others with similar likes .
#Text=Find " Tastebuds " .
#Text=A play on words , this refers to people you 'd like to be friends with on the site , perhaps people with similar tastes !
#Text=Simply click on the tab " Tastebuds " .
#Text=Once here , you can invite or browse for friends .
#Text=If you want to search for people already on the site with similar tastes , be sure to have checked your favorite tastes in your profile .
#Text=Once done , you can " browse people with similar profiles " from the highlighted links ; simply click on the links and see who turns up .
#Text=If you 've joined via Facebook , your friends ' list will pop up when you are looking for friends .
#Text=Simply invite the people you 'd like to share the site with .
#Text=Alternately , you can check out the people whose profiles pop up on the right hand side .
#Text=You can select them by the amount of times they have been " tastebudded " , by photos , or by recipes .
#Text=Compare their " similarity to you " and choose away .

column1: #Text=Find recipes .
#Text=Once your preferences are in place , you can start hunting for recipes .
#Text=Simply click on the " Recipes " tab at the top right hand corner and you will be taken to the " FoodFinder " search tool .

column3:
abstract[141]	new[141]	_	_

37-24	2401-2402

column1: #Text=You can either let it find recipes for you based simply on your preferences , or you can type in an ingredient and see what returns come back .
#Text=For example , keying in " strawberry " returns the recipes shown in the image below .
#Text=Alter a recipe .
#Text=If the recipe does n't have the right quantities or nutritional value , have Yummly change the quantities or substitute ingredients for you .
#Text=Click on the " Edit/Substitutions " tab and you will able to change the amount and the ingredients .
#Text=Change the ingredients ( a list of suggestions will pop up , for example , raspberries instead of strawberries , and you can modify the amounts for more or less diners .
#Text=Click on " Save " and the modified recipe will now show .
#Text=Once you alter a recipe , it will show up as you being its creator .
#Text=If you do n't like your new creation , simply click on the tab " Original recipe " , located in the left hand corner .
#Text=Make the most of the stats .
#Text=Alongside each recipe are the nutritional stats and the price per serve .
#Text=For those on a budget or health-conscious diet , this is a really useful way to tell whether or not your recipe is suitable , or needs adjusting to decrease the cost or unhealthy content .
#Text=Import your own recipes .
#Text=You can click on " Import recipes " to draw in your favorite recipes and to form a collection .
#Text=Make recommendations .
#Text=Click on " Recommendations " under your user name and the recommendations page will open .
#Text=Here you can rate your favorite recipe finds ( click on the stars from 1 to 5 ) , or you can simply rate them as you find them through FoodFinder , after trying them .
#Text=Video
#Text=Tips
#Text=You can quickly see the values of each recipe in the right hand box that appears with each recipe returned .
#Text=Recipes can be printed if wished ; click on the " Print " button .
#Text=You can share recipes with friends on Facebook ; just click the " Share " button .
#Text=And the " Like " button is also available .
#Text=Similar recipes will be suggested next to the recipe that you 're currently looking at .
#Text=Click on them to navigate to the new recipe .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Internet
